text: Apache2: mod_wsgi or mod_python, which one is better?
I am planning to write web service in python.
But, I found wsgi also does the similar thing.
Which one can be preferred?

Thank you
Bala
I am still confused.
Please help.

Better in my sense means:
1.
Bug will be fixed periodically.
Chosen by most developers.
Additional features like authentication tokens like AWS, can be supported out of the box.
No strong dependency on version.

( I see that wsgi requires python 2.6)
5.
All python libraries will work out of the box.
Scalable in the future.
Future upgrade don't cause any issues.
With my limited experience, I want these features.
There might be some I might be missing.

Thanks
Bala
I am sorry for all the confusion caused.
I just want to expose a restful web services in python language.
Is there a good framework?
